intro: Habenella, commonly known as the common rockrose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or subshrubs native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have small, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, or white, often arranged in clusters. They are characterized by their succulent leaves and ability to thrive in rocky or arid environments. Habenella species are often used in gardens for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
